sentences.en: " You is so brash sometimes, Miss Scarlett.
sentences.cn: " 你有时候太性急了, 思嘉小姐.

sentences.en: Beneath his brash exterior, he's still a little boy inside.
sentences.cn: 他外表盛气凌人，内心里还是个孩子。

sentences.en: Blue, for example, is peaceful, and yellow is brash.
sentences.cn: 例如, 蓝色表示宁静, 黄色表示急躁.

sentences.en: Brash journalists were crowding around the ambassador.
sentences.cn: 鲁莽的记者们围拢在大使周边。

sentences.en: He behaves in a brash way.
He scares people away by being so brash.
sentences.cn: 他狂妄自大把别人都吓跑了.

sentences.en: Her initial confidence can seem brash and naive.
sentences.cn: 她最初的自信看来是一种轻率和幼稚.

sentences.en: It would be foolish to spoil the opportunity by seeming too assured or brash.
sentences.cn: 要是给人以过于自信或者冒昧的印象,糟踏了这个机遇,那就太愚蠢了.

sentences.en: Mourinho says he will not be as brash and confrontational this season.
sentences.cn: 穆里尼奥说这赛季他将不再是傲慢或敌对性的.

sentences.en: Occasionally someone brash would ask if Celia would help him try the product out.
sentences.cn: 有时,也有个别死皮赖脸的人问西莉亚,她能不能帮他试试产品的性能.

sentences.en: On stage she seems hard, brash and uncompromising.
sentences.cn: 在台上她显得强硬、自负且毫不妥协。

sentences.en: Perhaps she had been too brash.
Some were suspicious of their brash cousin.
sentences.cn: 有人信不过这位厚颜无耻的堂兄弟.

sentences.en: That brash boy has been careless enough to prang up his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 那个鲁莽的小伙子由于不谨慎,导致他女朋友怀了孕.

sentences.en: The brash young First Lord of the Admiralty, Winston Churchill showed particular interest in naval aviation.
sentences.cn: 年青而性情急躁的海军大臣温斯顿·丘吉尔对海军航空特别关心.

words.tran_cn: 胃灼热地；骤雨般地；无礼地
无礼的，傲慢的；仓促的，性急的

trans.tran_cn: 傲慢的，轻率的，易碎的，脆的
trans.tran_en: behaving too confidently and speaking too loudly – used to show disapproval
